'''Dayton''' is a [[Borough (Pennsylvania)|borough]] in [[Armstrong County, Pennsylvania|Armstrong County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 553 at the [[United States Census 2010|2010 census]]. ==History== The [[Thomas Marshall House (Dayton, Pennsylvania)|Thomas Marshall House]] was listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] in 1976.<ref name="nris">{{NRISref|version=2010a}}</ref> ==Geography== Dayton is located at {{coord|40|52|52|N|79|14|29|W|type:city}} (40.881095, -79.241526){{GR|1}}. According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the borough has a total area of {{convert|0.4|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 543 people, 229 households, and 150 families residing in the borough. The [[population density]] was 1,208.1 people per square mile (465.9/km²). There were 254 housing units at an average density of 565.1 per square mile (217.9/km²). The racial makeup of the borough was 100.00% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]]. There were 229 households out of which 29.7% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 54.6% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 7.9% had a female householder with no husband present, and 34.1% were non-families. 31.9% of all households were made up of individuals and 17.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.37 and the average family size was 2.97. In the borough the population was spread out with 22.7% under the age of 18, 6.6% from 18 to 24, 26.2% from 25 to 44, 23.0% from 45 to 64, and 21.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 42 years. For every 100 females there were 94.6 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 89.2 males. The median income for a household in the borough was $30,156, and the median income for a family was $36,250. Males had a median income of $26,719 versus $18,333 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the borough was $15,036. About 5.7% of families and 7.3% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 8.5% of those under age 18 and 9.6% of those age 65 or over. ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== *[http://www.daytonfair.com/ Dayton Fair] *[http://www.daytonvfd30.com/ Dayton Volunteer Fire Department] *[[West Shamokin High School]] {{Armstrong County, Pennsylvania}} {{Pittsburgh Metro Area}} [[Category:Populated places established in 1850]] [[Category:Pittsburgh metropolitan area]] [[Category:Boroughs in Armstrong County, Pennsylvania]]
